benchmark_details.name: MVHumanNet++
benchmark_details.overview: MVHumanNet++ is the largest multi-view human capture dataset, containing 4,500 unique identities, 9,000 daily outfits, and 645 million frames with extensive annotations such as human masks, camera parameters, 2D/3D keypoints, SMPL/SMPLX parameters, and textual descriptions.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a large-scale dataset for advancing 3D human reconstruction tasks and various digital human applications.

data.source: Collected using two synchronized indoor multi-view capture systems.
data.annotation: Includes action localization, human masks, 2D/3D keypoints, camera parameters, SMPL/SMPLX parameters, and textual descriptions.

methods: Pilot studies in action recognition, NeRF reconstruction, and 3D Gaussian Splatting
methodology.calculation: Metrics are derived from the performance of models on evaluation tasks using the dataset.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy and better scores in PSNR, SSIM indicate improved model performance.
methodology.validation: Conducted pilot studies to validate dataset utility in real-world applications.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: The dataset includes a diverse range of performers covering different genders and ages.
